scenarioDescription:
The K2-84 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-84 is a star with 0.95 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.93 times its radius. It is located 929.14 light years away from the solar system.

K2-84 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-84 system


K2-84 b

K2-84 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2016-09, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-84 b is 6.392 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-84 b is 2.410 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-84 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


K2-84 c

K2-84 c was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2016-09, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-84 c is 4.770 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-84 c is 2.030 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.14, and a semi-major axis of 0.1768 astronomical units, K2-84 c could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-84, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-84 - System With 2 Exoplanets
